title: Report: Tennessee Titans re-signing center Corey Levin
description: The Tennessee Titans have reportedly reached a deal to bring veteran center Corey Levin back into the fold 2025.
excerpt: The Tennessee Titans have reportedly reached a deal to bring veteran center Corey Levin back into the fold 2025.
text: The #Titans are re-signing C Corey Levin, a league source said.Levin will provide valuable IOL depth, especially considering that starting C Lloyd Cushenberry is recovering from a season-ending Achilles injury.Levin offers the offense continuity & experience at C/G. pic.twitter.com/rhvVLuc3aa— Justin M (@JustinM_NFL) March 14, 2025The Tennessee Titans made a small free agency move on Friday, re-signing one of their own.According to Justin Melo of The Draft Network, the Titans have come to terms with center Corey Levin on an undisclosed deal to return for the 2025 season. Levin is a solid depth piece and could help center Lloyd Cushenberry ease back into the fold as he recovers from the Achilles injury that ended his season. Originally drafted by the Titans in the sixth round of the 2017 NFL draft, Levin has spent time with the Denver Broncos and Chicago Bears before returning to Nashville in 2021. Over the past four seasons, he has seen action in 55 games, making four starts at guard or center. The Titans have started to overhaul their offensive line this offseason by adding Dan Moore, Kevin Zeitler and Blake Hance from outside the organization. Bringing back experienced veterans like Levin should help the Titans improve on one of their weakest units from 2024.  Facebook Twitter Email
html:
The #Titans are re-signing C Corey Levin, a league source said.

Levin will provide valuable IOL depth, especially considering that starting C Lloyd Cushenberry is recovering from a season-ending Achilles injury.

Levin offers the offense continuity & experience at C/G. pic.twitter.com/rhvVLuc3aa

— Justin M (@JustinM_NFL) March 14, 2025

The Tennessee Titans made a small free agency move on Friday, re-signing one of their own.

According to Justin Melo of The Draft Network, the Titans have come to terms with center Corey Levin on an undisclosed deal to return for the 2025 season. Levin is a solid depth piece and could help center Lloyd Cushenberry ease back into the fold as he recovers from the Achilles injury that ended his season. 

Originally drafted by the Titans in the sixth round of the 2017 NFL draft, Levin has spent time with the Denver Broncos and Chicago Bears before returning to Nashville in 2021. Over the past four seasons, he has seen action in 55 games, making four starts at guard or center. 

The Titans have started to overhaul their offensive line this offseason by adding Dan Moore, Kevin Zeitler and Blake Hance from outside the organization. Bringing back experienced veterans like Levin should help the Titans improve on one of their weakest units from 2024.
